page.title: 07Cockfield Hall Farm (cont)
page.content: There is still evidence of a moat which used to surround the house.We saw a sundial on the front of the house and noticed that no two interior doors in The Hall were alike.There is a small orchard to the front of the house containing some very old gnarled fruit trees.Old photographs of the farm usually show geese.The farm land extends to 104.5 acres but in 1979 82 acres were taken over for opencast mining.The Bainbridges had a farm sale and retained very few animals.As their land is gradually restored to them their stock will increase.Mr & Mrs Bainbridge have found the opencast work very interesting and have a good relationship with the site workers. They have sold some of their badly drained land to the N.C.B. and in return will receive some flatter better quality land.
